result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J. Lallemont was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
DE must submit an apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.

timeConds.notes: With huber and is to commence within 15 days of 9/20/16

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 11:00 am - DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Tyler J. Lallemont appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls Patti Farina. Sworn.  Lex makes objection re: restitution amount.  Objection noted and overruled.  Direct by DA.  Exhibit #1 marked, identified, offered and received.  Cross by Atty Lex.  Exhibit #2 & #3 marked.  Re-direct by DA.  Exhibit 2 identified, offered and received.  Court questions DE.  Re-direct by DA.  Re-cross by Lex.  Atty Lex calls Tyler Lallemont.  Sworn.  Direct by Lex.  Cross by DA.  Argument by attorneys.  Court summation and ruling by court.  DE owes $ amount of exhibit #1 less amounts of two returned items and tax associated with them.
DNA Submission Form
Scheduling
Restitution hearing on October 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.

11:03 am - DA calls case and states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Tyler J. Lallemont appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Comments by Lex.    DE enters plea of NO CONTEST.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  DE to submit DNA sample at PRSO.  DA can certify victims rights compliance.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC.  Victim reads statement.  Comments by Court.  Court imposes:

Sentence withheld - 1 year probation
Conditions of probation
$243 court costs
$200 DNAAS
5 days jail with huber and is to commence within 15 days of 9/20/16.
DE must submit an apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
Restitution to be determined.  Lex will be filing motion for restitution hearing.

Appeal rights given.
